summary:
Main issue: Customer is unable to install the latest update for design software due to an "unknown error" at 75%.

Attempted solutions: Agent asks for screenshot of error message and operating system version, then suggests disabling third-party antivirus tools as a potential solution. Agent provides a direct download link as a workaround.

Final outcome/current status: Customer successfully installs the software after disabling their antivirus.

action_items.action: 1. Escalation needed: Assign the issue to the engineering team to investigate and fix the conflict with third-party antivirus tools.
2. Documentation update: Update the software documentation to include information about potential conflicts with antivirus tools and provide a direct download link as a workaround.
3. Technical action: Provide a direct download link for customers who encounter the issue in the future.

knowledge_articles.title: Common Technical Issues and Solutions
knowledge_articles.content: Troubleshooting steps for common technical problems: 1) Clear browser cache 2) Try a different network 3) Update software 4) Restart the application

knowledge_articles.title: Network Connectivity Problems
knowledge_articles.content: Solutions for network-related errors: - Check internet connection - Verify firewall settings - Test alternative networks - Reset network settings

knowledge_articles.title: Software Update Requirements
knowledge_articles.content: Guide to updating software: 1) Check current version 2) Download latest update 3) Install update 4) Verify successful update

routing.justification: The reason for routing the ticket to the Engineering team is to ensure that the conflict with third-party antivirus tools is properly investigated and fixed. This will prevent similar issues from occurring in the future and provide a more stable and reliable experience for customers.

similar_conversations.text:
Main issue: Customer is unable to install the latest update for design software due to an "unknown error" at 75%.

Attempted solutions: Agent asks for screenshot of error message and operating system version, then suggests disabling third-party antivirus tools as a potential solution. Agent provides a direct download link as a workaround.

Final outcome/current status: Customer successfully installs the software after disabling their antivirus.

Main issue: The API was rejecting the customer's payment gateway integration with an "Invalid SSL certificate" error, despite the customer's valid and up-to-date cert.

Attempted solutions: The agent asked the customer to share the output of `openssl s_client -connect yourgateway.com:443` to investigate the issue further. Once the root cause was identified (the server only supports TLS 1.2, while the customer's system requires TLS 1.3), the agent provided a quick fix by upgrading the protocol.

Final outcome/current status: The issue was resolved after upgrading the protocol. The customer successfully integrated their payment gateway with the API.

Main issue: The customer was experiencing an issue with their app saying "no internet connection" despite having a working Wi-Fi connection.

Attempted solutions:

* Checking the app's network permissions
* Clearing the app cache

Final outcome or current status:
The customer turned on the app's local network permission and cleared the app cache, which fixed the issue. The agent flagged the issue to the development team for further investigation.

immediate_steps.details: Check if refund has been processed

recommendations.reasoning: Based on similar cases and standard billing procedures

time_prediction.explanation: Based on the conversation, it is likely that the issue can be resolved quickly as the cause of the problem (conflict with third-party antivirus tools) is relatively straightforward and easy to address. Additionally, the agent has provided a direct download link as a potential solution, which will save time compared to troubleshooting and investigating other possible causes. Therefore, I estimate that it will take around 1.5 hours to resolve the issue.
